tei: HEADPIECE AND TAILPIECE ENGRAVINGS IN THE QUARTO AND LARGE FOLIO WORKS II (1735) Location Format Design and Source Page in 4o and(large 2o) 4o or large 2o Works Title Page 4o, 2o Oval vignette, 69mm Tailpiece from Odyssey XXIV, without motto; end of collected Essay on Man Design [Fig. 4] Essay on ManTitle 4o Not present 2o Apollo Title page of collected Essay on Man (Foxon P851), reissued here End of Design 4o No engraving 2o Oval vignette, 79mm Tailpiece from collected Essay on Man Epistle 1, p. 9 (7) 4o New headpiece with simple Bolingbroke arms in central oval; initial ‘A’ (29 × 29 mm) [Fig. 7] 2o Headpiece from Odyssey ‘A General View of the Epic Poem’, with elaborate Bolingbroke arms substituted in central oval; initial ‘A’ (48 × 48 mm) from Odyssey IV [Fig. 6] Epistle 1, p. 24 (20) 4o Mermaid fountain Tailpiece from Odyssey VII 2o No engraving Epistle 2, p. 39 (33) 4o Siren Tailpiece from Odyssey VI 2o No engraving Epistle 3, p. 56 (48) 4o Siren Tailpiece from Odyssey VI 2o No engraving Epistle 4, p. 76 (66) 4o Apollo Title page of collected Essay on Man (Foxon P851), used as tailpiece [Fig. 5] 2o No engraving Ethic Epistles, Second BookCobham, p. 47 (7) 4o Headpiece from Odyssey V, with Temple arms substituted in central circle [Fig. 8] 2o New headpiece with Temple arms supported by putti [Fig. 9] Lady, p. 71 (33) 4o, 2o Mermaid fountain Tailpiece from Odyssey VII [Fig. 2] (Continued)
